meanings.definition: The act of reinforcing or supporting a beam or joist by attaching another piece of lumber alongside it.
meanings.sent1: The sistering of the beam made it stronger.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter used sistering to support the joist.
meanings.sent3: The beam and its sistering lumber went for a walk together.
meanings.sent4: The sistering of the joist was like a hug from a friend.
meanings.sent5: The sistering of the beam stood out like a superhero's cape.

meanings.definition: The act of providing support or assistance to someone in a similar role or position.
meanings.sent1: Her sistering of the new employee was kind.
meanings.sent2: The team showed great sistering to their captain.
meanings.sent3: The sistering between colleagues made work more fun.
meanings.sent4: Her sistering was a beacon of light in the office.
meanings.sent5: The sistering among friends was heartwarming.

meanings.definition: The act of joining or connecting two things together closely.
meanings.sent1: The sistering of the puzzle pieces was perfect.
meanings.sent2: The sistering of the wires ensured a strong connection.
meanings.sent3: The sistering of the socks made them inseparable.
meanings.sent4: Their sistering was like a bond that couldn't be broken.
meanings.sent5: The sistering of the vines created a beautiful pattern.
